section: How to get DataCamp Premium Subscription
text:
How to get DataCamp Premium Subscription

DataCamp for Classrooms: for academic staff members to apply and become DataCamp classroom administrators. Gives 6 months of premium access to all DataCamp courses and certifications. Unlimited renewals are available as well. All at no cost.
DataCamp Donates Scholarships: provided by different non-profit organizations. This gives successful applicants one year premium access to all the contents with certification opportunities on DataCamp.
Github Student Development Pack: Get the invaluable Github Student Development Pack with numerous benefits with just an educational institution email account like jane.doe@buk.edu.ng. If you are a student of a university, interested in self-development and don‚Äôt have this Github student development pack, you don‚Äôt know what you are missing. As a student of any university, you are eligible to have an institutional email address provided by the ICT directorate of your university for both staff members and students. It is provided FREE to all institutions by Google.

title: EduTechTainMent Data Career Guide
text:
Learn Markdown
Markdown is the "language" in which those in the IT world write and communicate. It is a markup language and not a programming language per se. Learning markdown syntax is a very invaluable skill in this field. Even if you don‚Äôt have any plans on having any data skills, trust me when I tell you it is in your best interest to learn the markdown syntax. If you like the design of this website, then I am happy to let you know that this entire blogpost with its formatting was written in markdown. It can be learnt from between 2 days to about a week. Below are some resources to help you get started using Markdown. Refer to the guide by Markdown Guide website for general and detailed information about what you can use markdown for.

Markdown Tutorial
Commonmark
Daring Fireball: Markdown Syntax Documentation
Markdown Guide
Basic writing and formatting syntax - GitHub Docs
Quarto Markdown Basics
Codecademy Markdown Tutorial
Zapier Markdown Guide for Beginners

There are numerous tools 2 you can use to write markdown text, both offline, online and even on mobile.

title: EduTechTainMent Data Career Guide
text:
DataCamp Certifications Study Guide
DataCamp 3 suggests the following timelines for the career tracks:

Associate Data Analyst with Python (9 Courses: 36 hours, 2 skill assessments, and 5 projects)
Data Analyst in PowerBI (17 courses: 48 hours)
Data Analyst in Tableau (9 courses: 42 hours)
Data Analyst with R (36 Courses: 36 hours, 1 skill assessment, 2 projects)
Associate Data Analyst with SQL (11 Courses: 39 hours)
Associate Data Scientist with Python (23 Course: 90 hours, 3 skill assessments, 4 projects)
Associate Data Scientist with R (88 Courses: 88 hours, 4 skill assessments, 4 projects)
Data Scientist in R (8 courses: 27 hours, 2 projects)
Data Scientist in Python (8 courses: 23 hours, 2 projects)
Associate Data Engineer in SQL (9 courses: 30 hours, 2 projects)
Data Engineer in Python (12 courses: 57 hours, 3 projects)
Professional Data Engineer in Python (10 courses: 7 chapters, 2 projects)
Machine Learning Scientist with Python (21 courses: 85 hours, 1 skill assessment, 3 projects)
Machine Learning Scientist with R (16 courses: 65 hours, 1 skill assessment, 1 projects)
Machine Learning Engineer (12 courses: 44 hours, 2 projects)
Python Developer (5 courses: 3 chapters, 1 project)
Associate Python Developer (8 courses: 2 chapters, 2 project)
SQL Server Developer (10 courses: 41 hours)
R Developer (13 courses: 52 hours, 2 skill assessment, 1 projects)
Statistician with R (13 courses: 52 hours, 1 project)

title: EduTechTainMent Data Career Guide
text:
Structure of the DataCamp Certifications
DataCamp offers the following tracks for learners to choose from so they get the best custom-based learning experience:

Organization Track: A collection of well-curated courses by yourscholarshipp organization or DataCamp, to guide your learning and help you gain new skills.
Skill Track: Acquire new skills fast in courses that combine short expert videos with immediate hands-on exercises. This is based on particular skill sets learners wish to acquire.
Career Track consists of hand-picked courses by industry experts. You will learn all you need to start a new career in the data science field. This is based on the career options of the learners.

title: EduTechTainMent Data Career Guide
text:
Learning Platforms on Datacamp

Interactive Courses offered by DataCamp: Combine short videos with hands-on exercises.
Practice Exercises are also offered by DataCamp. Targeted at those who wish to Keep their skills sharp with quick daily challenges on desktop or Mobile app. You earn XP for every practice round.
DataCamp Signal‚Ñ¢ Assessments: To help gauge your skill level before starting any of the career tracks. How do your skills stack up? Discover your skill level in just 10 minutes to get personalized learning recommendations.

title: EduTechTainMent Data Career Guide
text:
Practice Platforms on DataCamp

DataCamp Projects: Apply your skills using tools like data Notebooks and complete a data analysis from start to finish.
DataCamp Case Studies: These hands-on scenarios give you a chance to navigate real-world problems across diverse industries.
DataCamp Code Alongs: During which, experienced DataCamp instructors will guide you through a vast selection of real world problems from start to finish.
DataCamp Competitions: Feeling a little bit adventurous? DataCamp competitions give you an opportunity to showcase your skillsets and even get to earn some cash while doing what you love!!!
DataCamp Tutorials: Develop your data science skills with tutorials. It covers everything from data visualizations in Tableau to version control in Git.
Popular Topics: Get ahead with the popular topics on DataCamp. Everything you need for each topic has been put in one place.

title: EduTechTainMent Data Career Guide
text:
DataCamp Certifications
Take the next step in your career and prove your competencies with DataCamp recognized career, technology, and fundamentals certifications (shown above). If you‚Äôre not quite ready for that next step, you can also prepare yourself with some tailored learning plans.






DataCamp Certifications



DataCamp certifications are developed in partnership with industry experts. They can help expand career opportunities, increase earning potential, and demonstrate expertise.








Duration



You‚Äôll have 30 days or 2 attempts to pass and get certified.


DataCamp offers both Associate and Professional certifications, designed to reflect entry-level and more experienced skill levels, respectively. The main difference between the two is the difficulty of the questions and the final exam requirements.

**Associate certification**: Designed for those starting out, and aligns with entry-level job expectations. It consists of a series of DataCamp assessments.
Professional certification: Designed for those with at least two years of experience. It requires a written and verbal presentation for the final exam.
DataCamp Learning Plans towards Certifications: DataCamp allows you to build a plan from scratch or take assessments to target lessons specifically for you.

title: EduTechTainMent Data Career Guide
text:
Register for a DataCamp Certification






Number of Attempts



Once you begin a certification you will have 30 days or 2 attempts to complete all requirements, whichever occurs first. If you‚Äôre unable to complete the requirements within 30 days from starting, your progress will reset.

title: EduTechTainMent Data Career Guide
text:
Import Important Libraries
To get started on this journey, here is a skeleton of all the important Python libraries/modules you need to import. I have created this code to prevent having to type out the same codes from scratch for every project.
Feel free to modify and use it as you wish. I will also be updating the code regularly, whenever I add contents to this EduTechTainMent Data Career Resources and Guide.
Steps Download the file via this LINK. Save the file in a convenient location, preferably a cloud storage directory you can access remotely on any device you are connected to. I would strongly recommend Koofr, which gives you 5 to 10Gb storage space and allows you to connect and sync your files seamlessly across multiple devices- desktop PC, laptops, android mobile phones, as well as connect and sync files from other popular cloud storages such as Google Drive, OneDrive, and DropBox. It aslo supprots WebDav. I use Koofr seamlessly across about 3 laptops, 2 desktop PCs and 1 android smartphone. I can access all my files from all these devices from anywhere in the world, and I don‚Äôt get restricted by location.
Load the file into your Jupyter notebook by running the code below without the quotation marks.


Show the code
%load ‚Äúpath_to_the_import_packages.py_file‚Äù


For example, this is the path to my file on my PC: load C:\Users\Admin\Koofr\import_packages.py
Finally, run the cell on your Jupyter notebook.

title: EduTechTainMent Data Career Guide
section: How do I Learn if Can‚Äôt Afford a Decent Specs Laptop or Don‚Äôt have a Personal Laptop or Desktop Computer?
text:
How do I Learn if Can‚Äôt Afford a Decent Specs Laptop or Don‚Äôt have a Personal Laptop or Desktop Computer?
Are you constrained by lack of a decent specification laptop or even desktop computer system? Don‚Äôt sweat !!! EduTechTainMent has got you covered. You can utilize the following methods to have access to a platform to learn and pratice your Data skills:

DataLab by DataCamp
Deepnote: The Education plan gives you all the benefits of the team Plan at no cost. You can also get the free version if you don‚Äôt have an educational institution email account. Use your mobile phone (read how to do that below).
Google Colab
Make use of your mobile phone as a last resort. Although its not the best, user-experience wise, it at least enables you to get started practicing without the need to procrastinate due to unavailability of a laptop computer. I will be sharing a guide on how to use you smartphone for this purpose soon. Just stay tuned.







EduTechTainMent Motto




‚ÄúOver Every Possessor of Knowledge, There is (Some) One (Else) More Knowledgeable‚Äù

title: üë®üèæ‚Äçüíª About Me
text:
About Me
I am Abdulwasiu Bamidele Popoola, a health professional with a passion for ICT. I am a self-taught web developer, and data professional. I have chosen to focus more on Artificial Intelligence and its varied applications in the healthcare industry. Given the current pervasive nature of AI, I hope to be able to contribute, in my own little way, to the AI landscape in my country and the globe at large. I am a passionate learner and show utmost dedication and grit when I put my mind to learning a skill. As a result I sought to become a self-taught data scientist by starting out as a data analyst. This will serve to equip me with the necessary analytical skills to succeed in data science. I believe learning is a step-wise but life-long process. Over the years I have worked to gather the requisite soft and technical skills to make me succeed in this endeavour. Given the importance of domain knowledge and expertise, I believe my wealth of experience in healthcare, better positions me to perform as an excellent health analyst and ultimately a data scientist.
A.B. Popoola is the immediate past Director of Health Services, University Health Services, Federal University Dutse (FUD). He is also an adjunct Lecturer, Dept. of Human Physiology, Faculty of Basic Medical Sciences, College of Medicine and Allied Medical Sciences, FUD. He is a Google Certified Data Analyst, took part in the Hamoye Data Science Fellowships ‚Äô22 and ‚Äô24, a DLYA certified in Data Science and Machine Learning, an ALX-T Udacity Certified Data Analyst, I4GxZuri Full Stack Software Developer, IBM Certified in Python for Data Science and AI, a McKinsey Forward Alumnus, INCO Certified in Green Digital Skills, DataCamp Certified in AI Fundamentals, DataCamp Certified in AI Literacy, Udacity Certified in AWS Machine Learning Foundations.
A. B. Popoola is a member of the Nigerian Medical Association (NMA), Member, Blacks in Technology, Nigeria and a Member, Data Science Network (DSN). I am also a DataCamp Classrooms Ambassador, Federal University Dutse and sole administrator of DataCamp Classrooms scholarships at FUD, mentoring, teaching and administering DataCamp scholarships to students of the university to help them gain globally relevant data skills. In addition, I am also a data mentor to many other students, and staff members, both within and outside the university. I have a passion to teach, impart knowledge and network with like minds both in health sector and the IT domain. Thus I Founded EduTechTainMent Ltd (ETTM), an EdTech company that is involved in leveraging the use of technology in education and is the developer and administrator of EduTechTainMent forum, EduTechTainMent Learning Management System and EduTechTainMent YouTube channel.
I am also a member of the team that won a TETFund grant to develop an AI powered system to revolutionize medical education in Nigeria (powered by Anatomia Ltd.)

title: üë®üèæ‚Äçüíª About Me
text:
Current Programs/Activities
To further prepare me for what lies ahead, I am currently enrolled in the following programs:

TechUp Africa Mentorship program with premium access DataQuest
Arewa Data Science Program on DataCamp
Arewa Deep Learning Scholarship.
DataCamp Scholarship by TechUp Africa
Lecturer for Postgraduate students of the Department of Economics for the professional and academics Masters Program in Health Economics.
Course facilitator for the AI and other Biotechnology courses offered by the Centre for Biotechnology Research, Bayero University Kano.
Won a grant together with some of my colleagues at Bayero University for the Physiology Career Awareness and Training Initiative 2025, sponsored by the Physiological Society, in UK.
Many more ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

title: üë®üèæ‚Äçüíª About Me
text:
Contributions and Public Events
In an effort to give back to the society, I am currently mentoring many students and university staff members in FUD and Nigeria at large. I hold regular training sessions to teach people various in-demand tech skills. Some of my mentees have made their marks in the data niche in Nigeria.
Furthermore, I am a DataCamp for Classrooms ambassador for Federal University Dutse and the administrator of the DataCamp for Classrooms scholarship scheme for my students in FUD. This affords my students the opportunity to learn and acquire globally-relevant skills in tech and particularly data field.
In recognition of my skills, knowledge, contribution, and passion for the advancement of the use of data driven insights to drive medical education and innovation, I was invited as a guest speaker at several events some of which include:

The Nigeria Medical Association (NMA) National Executive Council (NEC 2024) meeting in Kanem Borno during which I delivered a paper on Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Health: Prospects and Challenges in Low- and Middle- Income Countries.
Bayero University Medical Students Association (BUMSA) Artificial Intelligence (AI) Symposium Lectures on:

AI Fundamentals
Responsible use of AI by medical students and Professionals
How to be AI Professional in Medicine: Resources, Guides and Mentorship

Aminu Kano Teaching Hospital College Foundation Day (CFD) 2024 Lecture on: Ethical and Legal Implications of AI in Healthcare
The Nigerian Medical Association (NMA) Jigawa State chapter, Scientific Conference and Annual General Meeting (AGM) paper on: The Emergence of Artificial Intelligence and How it can Help in Modern Medical Practice.
The Nigerian Medical Association (NMA) Kano State chapter Annual General Meeting (AGM) Lecture on Application of Basic Artificial Intelligence (AI) in Medical Profession/Practice
A journal paper titled: The Rise of Telemedicine and Artificial Intelligence in Healthcare: A Boon or a Bane for the Kano Medical Students Association (KAMSA) Journal.
I was also invited as a guest speaker on 31st January 2025 at the KAMSA Health week, to talk on: The Emerging Landscape of Healthcare: Collaborative Intelligence.
Many more‚Ä¶..








Motto




‚ÄúOver Every Possessor of Knowledge, There is (Some) One (Else) More Knowledgeable‚Äù
